all_text_timv: D^* production in deep-inelastic scattering at low Q^2 [electronic resource]. Washington, D.C. : United States. Dept. of Energy. Office of Science, 2011. Oak Ridge, Tenn. : Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy. 5 pages : digital, PDF file. text txt rdacontent computer c rdamedia online resource cr rdacarrier Published through SciTech Connect. 07/01/2011. "fermilab-conf-11-344-e" Presented at 18th International Workshop on Deep Inelastic Scattering and Related Subjects (DIS 2010), Florence, Italy, 19-23 Apr 2010. Jung, Andreas W. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star Inclusive production of D* mesons in deep-inelastic scattering at HERA is studied in the range 5 < Q² < 100 GeV² of the photon virtuality and 0.02 < y < 0.70 of the inelasticity of the scattering process. The visible range for the D* meson is p{sub T} (D*) > 1.25 GeV and  < 1.8. The data were taken with the H1 detector in the years 2004 to 2007 and correspond to an integrated luminosity of 347 pb⁻¹. Single and double differential cross sections are measured. The results are compared to QCD predictions. AC02-07CH11359 Physics Of Elementary Particles And Fields. edbsc Deep Inelastic Scattering.
